snippet: Lawmakers could look to the federal judiciary as an example of doing a lot with only a tiny fraction of the country’s total budget, Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. wrote in his annual report.
abstract: Supreme Court Chief Justice John G Roberts Jr uses his year-end report on the federal judiciary to prod Congressional budget negotiators to resolve budget talks and control national debt.
lead_paragraph: Lawmakers could look to the federal judiciary as an example of doing a lot with only a tiny fraction of the country’s total budget, Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. wrote in his annual report.

headline.seo: Chief Justice Roberts Prods Congress on Fiscal Matters
headline.main: Chief Justice Prods Congress to Resolve Budget Talks and Control National Debt
headline.print_headline: Chief Justice Prods Congress to Resolve Budget Talks and Control National Debt
